intro: Geonoma multiflora var. negrensis, commonly known as the Negrense fern, is a species of fern native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It is characterized by its slender, arching fronds that are typically 30–60 cm in length. The plant has a dense, rhizomatous growth habit, allowing it to form compact clumps. Its leaves are pinnately compound, with a soft, leathery texture and a dark green color. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in understory layers of humid tropical forests.
